item.title: Help with IP's and Ports? [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Damoiscool Damoiscool
item.description:
@Damoiscool wrote:

EDIT: Wrong section, should be in client help.

Hey guys. I have a source and client, and I’m a little confused as I have never used a source+client like this. It has two worlds, I think they both run on the same port but I’m not 100% sure. What I’m trying to do is have both worlds running on a different port or ip, whichever would be best for having 1 Eco server and 1 PVP(spawn) server with separate character files, commands, teleports, items, object spawns, npc spawns, shops etc… How would I go about this given the following bits of code?

As you can see both the Ip’s are currently set to localhost, and the port is set to 43594. This is code from client.java

        public static String defaultServerIP = "127.0.0.1";        
        public static String defaultServerIPw2 = "127.0.0.1";
        public static String serverip = ""+defaultServerIP+"";
	public static int port = 43594;

Further down I see the following code, this is where it confuses me, are both worlds using 43594, 43595 or are they both using different ports?

public void WhatWorldIsWhatIp () { if(world == 1){ serverip = ""+defaultServerIP+""; port = 43595; } else { if(world == 2){ serverip = ""+defaultServerIPw2+""; port = 43595;

If it helps it is deathlypvpz v4.1… https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,633225.0.html

To avoid being flamed, I am not taking any credits, for the making of this server, except for what I have added, which is like 1% anyway, I have even added messages in the server which give credits to hack3r.

Read full topic
